abstract: A broad array of authors, academics, librarians and public interest groups are fighting Google’s plan to create a huge digital library and bookstore.
snippet: A broad array of authors, academics, librarians and public interest groups are fighting Google’s plan to create a huge digital library and bookstore.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Whenever it can, Google likes to have programmers solve its problems. But now it faces a dispute that even its ranks of lawyers and lobbyists are finding hard to smooth over.

headline.main: In E-Books, It’s an Army vs. Google
headline.print_headline: In E-Books, It’s an Army Vs. Google

abstract: European antitrust regulators said that they had tentatively accepted Microsoft’s concessions to settle two antitrust cases.
snippet: European antitrust regulators said that they had tentatively accepted Microsoft’s concessions to settle two antitrust cases.
lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS  European antitrust regulators said Wednesday that they had tentatively accepted Microsoft’s concessions to settle two antitrust cases, which the company said left both organizations free to focus on the next generation of technology giants, including Google.

headline.main: Microsoft Tries to Quell European Complaints
headline.print_headline: Antitrust Concessions by Microsoft Soothe Europeans

abstract: Recent concessions by Microsoft, including its offer to give European computer users a choice of Web browsers, appear to address European Union antitrust concerns, and cases against the company could be settled this year, the bloc’s competition commissioner said Wednesday.
snippet: Recent concessions by Microsoft, including its offer to give European computer users a choice of Web browsers, appear to address European Union antitrust concerns, and cases against the company could be settled this year, the bloc’s competition co...
lead_paragraph: European antitrust regulators said Wednesday that they had tentatively accepted Microsoft’s concessions to settle two antitrust cases, which the company said left both organizations free to focus on the next generation of technology giants, including Google, The New York Times’s James Kanter reported.

headline.main: Europe and Microsoft Seen Near Antitrust Deal

abstract: Google announced this week that it was partnering with makers of the Energy Detective, an in-home power usage monitor, to provide consumers with real time information on home power usage over the Web.
snippet: Google announced this week that it was partnering with makers of the Energy Detective, an in-home power usage monitor, to provide consumers with real time information on home power usage over the Web.
lead_paragraph: Google’s foray into the world of home energy management – first announced in February 2009 – took what looked like a substantial step forward on Monday, as the Internet media giant  unveiled its partnership with Energy, Inc, maker of the Energy Detective.

headline.main: Google and the Energy Detective Join Forces

abstract: The judge set a Nov. 9 deadline for a revised Google book settlement.
snippet: The judge set a Nov. 9 deadline for a revised Google book settlement.
lead_paragraph: The federal judge who is responsible for reviewing the Google book settlement that would create a vast digital library has set Nov. 9 as the date by which Google and its partners must submit a revised settlement for the court’s preliminary approval.

headline.main: Judge Sets Nov. 9 Deadline For Revised Google Book Settlement

abstract: Google announced this week that it was partnering with makers of the Energy Detective, an in-home power usage monitor, to provide consumers with real time information on home power usage over the Web.
snippet: Google announced this week that it was partnering with makers of the Energy Detective, an in-home power usage monitor, to provide consumers with real time information on home power usage over the Web.
lead_paragraph: From our colleagues at Green Inc.:

headline.main: Google and the Energy Detective Join Forces

abstract: Google addresses a question about free applications.
snippet: Google addresses a question about free applications.
lead_paragraph: “We have not yet found the evil room on our campus.” — Eric Schmidt, chief executive of Google, speaking to a group of reporters in New York and answering a question about whether its free applications are a plot to eventually charge for everything and take over the market.

abstract: Google, the Internet search and advertising giant, recently began hiring again and is looking for companies to buy as it sees signs of an economic recovery.
snippet: Google, the Internet search and advertising giant, recently began hiring again and is looking for companies to buy as it sees signs of an economic recovery.
lead_paragraph: Google, the global Internet search and advertising giant, holds a prime vantage point from which to observe economic trends. And Google, though perhaps not a stand-in for the economy a whole, is starting to see a recovery. The company recently began hiring again and is looking for companies to buy — both activities that had been held in check for the last year.

headline.main: The Economy Looks Rosier Through Google’s Glasses
